business.headline: RBI MPC meet begins today: Will rate cuts finally return?In its October meeting, the MPC kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% for a fourth straight time. RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra had then said that inflation had moderated sharply, giving the committee confidence to maintain its stance.

EU to push ahead with plan to use Russia's frozen assets for Ukraine: ReportEU leaders agreed in October to meet Ukraine's "pressing financial needs" for the next two years but stopped short of endorsing a plan to use 140 billion euros ($162 billion) in frozen Russian sovereign assets in Europe as a loan for Kyiv, due to concerns raised by Belgium.

From ICICI and HDFC to SBI: Here's what 5 major banks are charging on personal loansBefore applying for a personal loan, it's worth knowing how much the leading banks are charging at the moment. Whether you prefer a private lender or a public-sector bank, understanding the latest interest rates can guide you towards a smarter borrowing decision.

Rent, cars, credit: CA explains why old financial wisdom no longer worksThe financial world young earners face today looks nothing like what their parents experienced. From renting to car ownership, an expert says that traditional advice no longer fits today's numbers, and sticking to it may do more harm than good.
Sensex closes 500 points lower, Nifty below 26,100; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 503.63 points to close at 85,138.27, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 143.55 points to end at 26,032.20.

Aequs IPO to open for bidding soon: Subscribe or skip the Rs 900 crore issue?Aequs IPO is sized at Rs 921.81 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 5.40 crore shares worth Rs 670 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.03 crore shares worth Rs 251.81 crore.

Planning to rent in 2025? Here's what changes with the new renting rulesOne of the biggest changes in the New Rent Rules 2025 is that all rental agreements must now be digitally stamped and registered online within 60 days

Rs 10,000 SIP vs Rs 1.2 lakh lump sum: Which creates more wealth?Is a Rs 10,000 monthly SIP smarter for long-term wealth, or does investing Rs 1.2 lakh at once create a bigger corpus? As markets turn unpredictable, this question is becoming more important for everyday investors.

Gold softens, silver drops: Why are they losing momentum after Monday's rally?Gold and silver paused their strong rally from Monday, opening lower on Tuesday amid profit booking and weaker global sentiment. The dip raises a key question: why have the metals lost momentum so quickly?

Will Nifty cross 29,000 by 2026? Here's what this global brokerage expectsDomestic flows remain steady, earnings have held up better than expected, and the broader macro backdrop has turned more predictable. Together, these have opened the door for fresh medium-term forecasts.

8th Pay Commission: Government clarifies on DA-basic pay merger plans. Details hereResponding to a written question in the Lok Sabha, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary stated that there is no proposal at present to combine any part of the existing DA with basic pay.

Meesho IPO to open soon: Will it turn into next stock market jackpot? Check GMPMeesho IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 5,421.20 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 38.29 crore shares worth Rs 4,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 10.55 crore shares worth Rs 1,171.20 crore.

The dark side of lending: Loan recovery harassment and its mental health impactLoan recovery harassment is real, widespread, and it is silently pushing many into anxiety, depression, and even suicide.

Explained: Why Bajaj Housing Finance shares fell 9% todayBajaj Housing Finance stock has now slipped almost 10% in the past 5 days, 13% in the past month, 22.83% in the last 6 months, 28.85% over the past year and 41.46% over the last five years.
Sensex opens 300 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; HDFC Bank down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 132.28 points to 85,509.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 31.90 points to 26,143.85 as of 9:26 am.
Who is Ramakrishnan Chander, LIC's new Managing Director He joined LIC in 1990 as an Assistant Administrative Officer and has steadily moved up the ranks over the decades.

Big December IPO lineup: Key details of Meesho, Aequs, Vidya Wires and 13 othersFour mainboard IPOs — Meesho, Wakefit Innovations, Aequs and Vidya Wires are scheduled to hit the market, while a long list of SME issues will follow through the month.

India's Foreign Direct Investment up 18% in April-September, US inflows doubleThe inflow from the US more than doubled to USD 6.62 billion during the period, according to the latest government data released on Monday.

Why most early retirement plans fail: Expert breaks down the real problemMost people chasing early retirement don't fail because they earn too little, they fail because they rely on assumptions that don't hold up in real life. An expert explains where FIRE plans usually go wrong.

entertainment.headline: Rana Daggubati, Dulquer Salmaan react to Deepika Padukone's 8-hour shift stance Actor-producer Rana Daggubati and Dulquer Salmaan addressed the practicality and realities of fixed-hour workdays on film sets following renewed debate sparked by Deepika Padukone's remarks.

Stranger Things 5 breaks Netflix record, all seasons in top 10 The fifth season of Stranger Things has achieved the largest English-language series launch on Netflix, with 59.6 million views in its first five days. The release, which included only four episodes initially, has also led to all five of the show's seasons appearing on the platform's Top 10 chart.

Why Tere Ishk Mein is the most complex and provocative love story in a while Tere Ishk Mein isn't a film you simply watch, it's a film that pulls you into a psychological storm. Messy, flawed, provocative and emotionally unsettling.

Potter meets Malfoy: Daniel Radcliffe, Tom Felton reunite after 14 years for Broadway Actors Daniel Radcliffe and Tom Felton, well-known for their roles in the Harry Potter series, met in New York City at a special screening of the filmed version of Merrily We Roll Along, in which Radcliffe starred in its recent stage revival.

Miley Cyrus confirms engagement to Maxx Morando, shares what astounded her most Singer Miley Cyrus has confirmed her engagement to musician Maxx Morando after four years of dating. Cyrus opened up about the significance of their relationship, the importance of privacy, and the symbolism behind their connection in a recent interview.

Bigg Boss 19: Rajiv Adatia supports Gaurav Khanna after emotional breakdown Rajiv Adatia has voiced support for Bigg Boss 19 finalist Gaurav Khanna after a journalist's question regarding his family life prompted an emotional response at a recent press conference.

Stray Kids sweep 6 Billboard Charts; Do It lands Hot 100 debut K-pop boy band Stray Kids have set a new milestone on the Billboard charts, as their album DO IT debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 this week. The group became the first artist to have their first eight chart entries premiere at the top position.

Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar to feature 4-minute post-credit scene: Report Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh and directed by Aditya Dhar, is set for a major release on December 5, 2025. The film features a 4-minute post-credits scene and is now one of the lengthiest Indian films, surpassing Animal and Pushpa 2 in runtime.

Mammootty on his role in upcoming film Kalamkaval: You may not like my character Mammootty revealed insights into his role and the casting decisions for his upcoming film Kalamkaval, highlighting his preference for Vinayakan in the lead. The film is set to release in theatres on December 5.

Winona Ryder reveals tragic inspiration behind Little Women role Winona Ryder reflects on a tragic event from her early twenties that deeply influenced her performances in both Little Women and Stranger Things, sharing how personal loss shaped her approach to portraying grief and resilience on screen.

Technology democratised filmmaking: Kunaal Roy Kapoor on AI and creativity Kunaal Roy Kapur believes digital detox is complicated, noting mobile addiction is fuelled by personalised content that "hacked your brain." While speaking exclusively to India Today, he stresses that while formal films decreased, OTT offered non-mainstream actors higher quality, complex roles.

Did Miley Cyrus get engaged? Diamond ring at Avatar premiere sparks rumours Singer Miley Cyrus and Maxx Morando appeared together at the Los Angeles premiere of Avatar: Fire and Ash, drawing attention with a visible diamond ring on Cyrus's finger. The couple has not commented on engagement rumours.

Aftab Shivdasani calls box office the key to success: It's the ultimate barometer Aftab Shivdasani speaks exclusively to India Today, scoffing at "comeback" suggestions since he never left the industry. He admits waiting patiently for worthwhile films, stressing that box office success remains the ultimate barometer, not just OTT viewership.

Daughter Aishwarya shares pics from Rajinikanth's IFFI honour with emotional note Aishwarya Rajinikanth shared heartfelt photos and a gratitude-filled note from IFFI Goa, where Rajinikanth received a lifetime achievement award for completing 50 years in cinema. The superstar's milestone celebration included family moments, fan tributes, and special honours at the festival.

Gulshan Devaiah on Tamil debut with Madhavan in Legacy: A Satisfying Experience Actor Gulshan Devaiah discussed his role and working alongside Madhavan in the yet-to-be-released Tamil crime drama series Legacy, marking his Tamil debut.

Amitabh Bachchan may call marriage his biggest mistake, jokes Jaya Bachchan Actor-politician Jaya Bachchan offers frank opinions on marriage, her relationship with Amitabh Bachchan, and advice for her granddaughter during a rare interview, reflecting changing societal attitudes.

Stranger Things 5: Inside the big Will Byers twist that changes the game for Vecna Stranger Things Season 5 Volume I ends with a stunning twist as Will Byers unleashes powers stronger than anyone expected. The reveal reshapes the final battle against Vecna and shifts the focus away from Eleven for the first time.

Trivikram's film with Venkatesh titled Bandhu Mitrula Abhinandanalatho: Reports Director Trivikram Srinivas and actor Venkatesh's first directorial collaboration begins with a reported title registration, stirring interest among Telugu film fans ahead of the film's shoot.

Dulquer Salmaan: Was pushed around on Bollywood set until I faked being a star Dulquer Salmaan shared his experience of creating the illusion of being a star in the Hindi film industry. He highlighted cultural differences and perception challenges between the film industries.

general news.headline: We value them: Russia approves key pact with India ahead of Putin's visitRussia's lower house of parliament approved a key military pact with India, enabling mutual logistical support for military operations, exercises, and disaster relief, ahead of President Putin's New Delhi visit.

Ridiculous statement: India slams Pak's Sri Lanka aid flight clearance chargeAccording to the MEA, the request for overflight clearance from Pakistan was received by the Indian High Commission in Islamabad around 1 pm on December 1, 2025. Citing the urgency of humanitarian aid, the ministry said the government processed the request the same day and granted permission by 5:30 pm.

13-year-old executes family's killer in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan, 80,000 watchA 13-year-old boy executed a man convicted of murdering 13 members of his family in Afghanistan's eastern province of Khost. Around 80,000 people watched the execution, which was ordered by the Afghan Supreme Court and sanctioned by the Taliban's supreme leader, Hibatullah Akhundzada. The public execution has been condemned by the UN Special Rapporteur on Afghanistan.

Can Jamaat-e-Islami spring a surprise by beating BNP in Bangladesh?The Khaleda Zia-led BNP was considered an unchallenged frontrunner in the Bangladesh general election promised in February 2026 by chief advisor Muhammad Yunus. A new poll shows the Jamaat-e-Islami breathing down the BNP's neck with a difference of just four percentage points. This is why the Jamaat gained and why India needs to be prepared for any eventuality.

Rejuvenated Rohit, Virat look to seal series for India in RaipurIND vs SA: India arrive in Raipur having won a tense opening fixture in Ranchi. Rejuvenated by the presence of Rohit and Kohli, the hosts will look to seal the series in the second ODI.

LIVE: Counting of votes underway in 12 wards; BJP, AAP brace for crucial verdictDelhi MCD Bypolls Result Live Updates: Counting begins for the bypolls in 12 Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) wards, with results expected to reveal the voter strength of BJP and AAP, while offering Congress a chance to regain ground in the capital. Of the 12 wards that went to polls on November 30, nine were previously held by the BJP and three by the AAP. All eyes will be especially fixed on the results of Shalimar Bagh B and Dwarka B wards. Voter turnout stood at 38.51%, notably lower than the 50.47% recorded in the 2022 elections for all 250 MCD wards. Stay tuned with India Today for live updates.

Delhi chokes as AQI edges closer to severe again; cold wave to hit in 2 daysAmid the toxic air crisis, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast a cold wave in the national capital from Friday, with temperatures expected to drop by at least 2 degrees Celsius over the next three days.

Can't roll out red carpet for intruders: Supreme Court on missing Rohingyas pleaThe Supreme Court slammed a petition seeking the tracking of five Rohingya refugees, asking, "If an intruder is caught under the law, do you want us to roll out a red carpet for them?"

'Not doing anything wrong': Meet the man who's making your private data publicUnder the pretext of purchasing leaked data in bulk for marketing, we spoke to 'Rakesh' at length. And among other things, he said he'd done no wrong in creating the ProxyEarth.org website.

One God for drinkers, one for...: Revanth Reddy's Hindu deities remark stirs rowTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy allegedly mocked the existence of multiple Hindu deities and even went on to say that Hanuman was the god of the unmarried.
Watch: Trump appears to fight sleep during 3-hour-long cabinet meetingThe 79-year-old president appeared to have difficulty staying awake at several points during the three-hour cabinet meeting.

Live: Rajya Sabha may move motion against Renuka Chaudhary over 'barking' remarkParliament Winter Session Live: On Wednesday, the Rajya Sabha is likely to initiate a privilege motion against Renuka Chaudhary over her recent remarks involving "dogs and barking," which the House views as a potential breach of parliamentary dignity and security norms. The Upper House is currently examining the matter, even as political strategy intensifies ahead of the next sitting. Leaders of the INDIA bloc are scheduled to meet tomorrow at 9.45 am in Parliament to plan their coordinated strategy on the floor of the House. Meanwhile, an all-party meeting has reached a consensus to hold a full-day debate on Vande Mataram on Tuesday, followed by discussions on poll reforms on December 9.

Miley Cyrus confirms engagement to Maxx Morando, shares what astounded her mostSinger Miley Cyrus has confirmed her engagement to musician Maxx Morando after four years of dating. Cyrus opened up about the significance of their relationship, the importance of privacy, and the symbolism behind their connection in a recent interview.

We are ready: Putin says Russia prepared to fight if Europe chooses warRussian President Vladimir Putin repeatedly said that Moscow has no intention of attacking Europe, despite concerns voiced by several EU governments. "But if Europe suddenly wants to wage a war with us and starts it, we are ready right away," he warned.

India's next in line: Jaiswal, Ruturaj must prove they belong nowTwo young batters, two crossroads. Jaiswal battles a left-arm pace weakness, Gaikwad seeks validation in his best format. South Africa will reveal whether they're stopgaps—or pillars of India's ODI future.

Sunny Leone's poster to ward off 'evil eye'? Farmer's unique crop-saving methodA farmer in a Karnataka village has put up a large poster of actress Sunny Leone in his cotton field to ward off the "evil eye" and protect his high-value crop.

Why Tere Ishk Mein is the most complex and provocative love story in a whileTere Ishk Mein isn't a film you simply watch, it's a film that pulls you into a psychological storm. Messy, flawed, provocative and emotionally unsettling.

US tax rules for F-1 and J-1 visa: What Indian students must knowStudying in the US is a dream for thousands of Indian students each year, but it also comes with important tax responsibilities. Even without earning income, students on F-1 or J-1 visas may need to file specific IRS forms to stay compliant.
Air India says check-in systems restored after glitch delays several flightsThe third-party system glitch at several airports late Tuesday affected Air India and other airlines, causing brief delays.

No compromise reached, but constructive: Russia on Ukraine peace talks with USRussia and the US made no breakthrough on a Ukraine peace deal after a five-hour Kremlin meeting, during which both sides discussed the initial US plan was broken down into four parts, said Putin's top diplomatic aide.

Tamilakam's travels and travails: Civilisational flames to political fire-stormsTamil Nadu is the graveyard of national political parties. It buried the Congress at its peak then in 1967. The BJP, also at its peak now, has been pregnant with possibilities but has failed to deliver.

Will discuss Indian imports with PM Modi: Putin on his upcoming India visitRussian President Vladimir Putin said he will discuss expanding Indian imports with PM Narendra Modi during his upcoming visit, while accusing European nations of choosing confrontation over dialogue.

Virat Kohli set to play Vijay Hazare Trophy after 15 yearsStar India batter Virat Kohli on Tuesday informed the Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) that he will be available for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy, marking his first appearance in the domestic one-day competition since 2010.

Bride asks for bulb on wedding night, nervous groom vanishes; found after 5 daysA groom from Meerut vanished on his wedding night, sparking panic and sorrow in his family. After five days, he was found safe in Haridwar, revealing mental stress as the cause of his disappearance.

Raj Nidimoru's sister welcomes Samantha: We stand by them without hesitationActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru's wedding on December 1 in Coimbatore was followed by a warm family welcome, with Raj's sister sharing a heartfelt message and the first family portrait.

Rana Daggubati, Dulquer Salmaan react to Deepika Padukone's 8-hour shift stanceActor-producer Rana Daggubati and Dulquer Salmaan addressed the practicality and realities of fixed-hour workdays on film sets following renewed debate sparked by Deepika Padukone's remarks.

sports.headline: Serena Williams denies tennis return despite re-entering anti-doping test pool Serena Williams put to rest mounting speculation about her tennis future after confirming she has no plans to return, even as her re-entry into the International Tennis Integrity Agency anti-doping pool stoked widespread comeback rumors.

Haaland creates history as Manchester City down Fulham in goal fest Manchester City extended their winning streak over Fulham with a 5–4 victory, as Erling Haaland became the fastest player to reach 100 Premier League goals. Newcastle and Tottenham played out a 2–2 draw, with Cristian Romero scoring twice for Spurs, including a stoppage-time equaliser.

Junior Men's Hockey World Cup: India beat Switzerland 5-0 to reach quarterfinals Manmeet Singh scored twice on his birthday as India sealed a dominant 5-0 win over Switzerland, completing an unbeaten pool stage and securing a place in the quarterfinals of the FIH Men's Junior Hockey World Cup.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma still going as hard as 28–30-year-olds, says Madan Lal Madan Lal says Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are playing with the freshness and intensity of 28–30-year-olds, insisting the senior duo should decide their own ODI future as they continue to drive India's performances.

No pressure of paycheque but motivated to do well for UP Warriorz in WPL: Deepti After being bought back by the UP Warriorz for Rs 3.2 crore ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League, star India all-rounder Deepti Sharma said the price tag brings her no pressure and, if anything, only pushes her to perform better in the fourth edition of the tournament.

Ben Stokes plays down England's dismal Gabba record ahead of pink-ball Test England captain Ben Stokes said his side carries no fear of the Gabba despite the venue's daunting Ashes history. Stokes said the current England squad has the confidence and edge to challenge Australia in their own backyard.

In-form Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma train hard in nets ahead of Ranchi ODI Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma trained hard during an intense net session, taking on throw-down specialists in tandem ahead of Wednesday's second ODI against South Africa.

2nd ODI Predicted XI: Should India try Tilak in place of Washington Sundar?IND vs SA: Washington Sundar bowled just three overs and had a very poor outing with the bat. Should India invest in Tilak Varma for the middle order position?

Grateful to India: Jayasuriya lauds PM Modi, EAM Jaishankar for swift Sri Lanka aidSanath Jayasuriya has thanked PM Modi, EAM Jaishankar and the people of India as teams lead massive rescue and relief efforts in cyclone-hit Sri Lanka. Operation Sagar Bandhu continues amid catastrophic flooding and landslides.

India to name T20I squad on Wednesday, medical update on Shubman Gill awaitedIndia vs South Africa: The selectors will announce India's T20I squad for the South Africa series on Wednesday (December 3), with the final decision hinging on an expected medical update on Shubman Gill.

Deepender Hooda Blames Haryana Govt Negligence for Death of Two Basketball PlayersIn this special report, Congress MP Deepender Hooda condemns the Haryana government for 'criminal negligence' following the tragic deaths of two young basketball players, Hardik Rathi and Aman, due to collapsing infrastructure. Hooda highlights the decay of sports facilities in the state, revealing, 'I gave 18.5 lakh rupees... for three years the government of Haryana refused to spend that money' on the Lakhan Majra stadium. The Rohtak MP demands ₹1 crore compensation and government jobs for the victims' families, asserting that the state's renowned sports culture is crumbling under the current administration.

AIFF eye flexibility in meeting with Sports Minister on ISL commercial rights tenderWith the ISL tender drawing zero bidders and structural concerns mounting, AIFF arrives for crisis talks, willing to be flexible on commercial terms—provided the government steps in to support national teams and key competitions.

Harshit Rana shrugs off outside noise, credits Kohli-Rohit for guidanceUnder scrutiny for allegedly receiving special backing from head coach Gautam Gambhir, young pacer Harshit Rana said he pays no attention to outside criticism. Rana also credited senior pros Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for playing a significant role in the good team environment.

Rohit, Kohli make team environment better, push youngsters to improve: Harshit RanaIND vs SA, 2nd ODI: Harshit Rana says the presence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli brings a positive and motivating environment to the Indian dressing room. Their guidance pushes youngsters to improve and creates a positive culture both on and off the field.

Revanth Reddy vs Lionel Messi: Telangana CM trains hard for Hyderabad face-offTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy hit the field at the MCHRD grounds as he continued preparations for his much-anticipated friendly football match against Argentina legend Lionel Messi on December 13.

Revanth Reddy vs Lionel Messi: Telangana CM trains hard for Hyderabad face-offTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy hit the field at the MCHRD grounds as he continued preparations for his much-anticipated friendly football match against Argentina legend Lionel Messi on December 13.

Sorry state of Gautam Gambhir's Indian Test team reaches Supreme CourtSupreme Court judge MM Sundaresh candidly referred to India's sorry state of affairs in Test cricket. The judge said that India's focus on white-ball cricket had ruined the Test team.

After Ranchi heroics, Harshit Rana opens up on dealing with online trollingAmid accusations that head coach Gautam Gambhir favours him, Harshit Rana has often been the target of online criticism. But the young pacer says he blocks out the noise, knowing that paying attention to it would only take away the freedom he needs to bowl at his best.

Sarfaraz Khan back in IPL? Mumbai star smashes 47-ball century in SMATSyed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025: Sarfaraz Khan struck his first T20 hundred to help Mumbai thrash Assam by 98 runs on Tuesday. His performance could boost IPL auction prospects amid strong demand for middle-order batters.

Hardik Pandya clicks selfie with pitch invader during SMAT 2025 clash: WatchIndia all-rounder Hardik Pandya's return to competitive cricket for Baroda in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy has been carefully observed by selectors and team management, with his fitness under scrutiny following his recent injury and the upcoming Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

Playing with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli brings a different confidence: Tilak VarmaIndia batter Tilak Varma enjoys the longer formats and has been seeking input from Virat Kohli on fitness and running between the wickets as he looks to make the most of the opportunities coming his way.

Robin Smith, former England batsman, dies aged 62Former England cricketer Robin Smith died at the age of 62 at his residence in Perth on Monday. His passing has brought widespread tributes, highlighting his courage against fast bowling and openness about mental health struggles.

Bavuma goes on a nostalgia trip, recalls watching Rohit Sharma in 2007 T20 World CupTemba Bavuma draws on memories of Rohit Sharma's early days as he assesses the influence of experienced Indian stars ahead of the ongoing series, emphasising the value of seasoned players and the demand for more top-level cricket.

Hardik Pandya returns to cricket, trumps Punjab with whirlwind 77-run knockSMAT 2025: Indian superstar Hardik Pandya made a tremendous return from injury. The all-rounder's heroics helped Baroda trump Punjab's total of 222 runs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
